author: Special Correspondent
text:
The annexe adjacent to Ananda Rangapillai central library at the Pondicherry University.Photo :Special Arrangement

Pondicherry University has opened the reading hall on the first floor of the library annexe adjacent to the Ananda Rangapillai Central Library on Thursday.

The annexe had been left unused for three years, since its inauguration on January 20, 2013, by former Union Minister V. Narayanasamy and former Vice-Chancellor J.A.K. Tareen.

Anisa Basheer Khan, Vice-Chancellor-in-charge, opened the reading hall as a preliminary step to making operational the entire library annexe.

R. Samyuktha, University Librarian and J. Sampath, Registrar-in-charge, faculty, research scholars and students participated in the function.

The annexe was constructed at a cost of nearly Rs.8 crore and has provision for a state-of-the-art laboratory for the visually-challenged, multimedia lecture hall and exclusive reading hall for research scholars.

Children’s library

It also has provision for a children’s library, conference hall, mini auditorium and cafeteria.

Prof. Anisa Basheer Khan said the library annexe would be made fully functional at the earliest to serve as an additional library to the existing Central Library.

title: Reading hall at Pondy varsity opened
